required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhancing Universal Health Coverage and Maternal, Newborn and Child Health in Kenya Through Digital Innovations
clinical_study.official_title: Innovative Partnership for Universal Health Coverage

lead_sponsor.agency: African Population and Health Research Center

collaborator.agency: Amsterdam Institute for Global Health and Development

clinical_study.source: African Population and Health Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at providing insights into Universal Health Coverage and evaluates the impact of I-PUSH program on maternal healthcare utilization, financial protection and women's empowerment, as well as to evaluate the impact of the LEAP training tool on community health volunteers and women's health literacy including their knowledge, behavior and uptake of respective services.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will use a three-pronged approach: year-long weekly Financial and Health Diaries, Baseline and Endline surveys, and qualitative interviews. The Diaries and the Surveys will be carried out in two Counties, Kakamega and Kisumu (Kenya). The qualitative interviews will be carried out in the two counties and in Nairobi as an additional county. The study will use a cluster randomized control trial design in Kakamega to evaluate the impact of I-PUSH program. In Kisumu, selected households will be followed-up to capture the health-seeking behavior, health insurance, and health expenditure pattern of households over time. The study will be initially for 17 months and will continue for three years subject to additional funding.

primary_outcome.description: Financial and health diaries will be collected on a weekly basis throughout the indicated study period

primary_outcome.measure: Maternal, Newborn and Child Health outcomes through out the continuum of care
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire based survey questions will be used to measure these outcomes

intervention.description: Innovative partnership for universal and sustainable healthcare

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Targets for the intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-targets for the intervention

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: African Population and Health Research Center
